Cameron.Action: Remains vigilant and focused on the policemen despite physical signs of stress such as trembling hands and bone-weary appearance.
Engages in seemingly casual conversation about his tattoo while keeping his eyes on the police, indicating awareness and control of the situation.
Moves deliberately to the pinball machine, scanning the room with his eyes, showing situational awareness and readiness.
Bolts and runs from cops despite handcuffs, shows desperation to escape.
Panics and pleads 'No!...God, don't shoot!' when cops chase him.
Shoves a cop flat on his back while escaping.
Aggressively incapacitates a lineman with multiple physical attacks to avoid capture.
Grabs the lineman's toolbox and escapes despite being handcuffed.
Holds his head and drinks from the stream after falling, showing resilience but no direct social warmth.
Attempts to free himself from handcuffs with wire-cutter and sledgehammer, enduring pain without complaint.
Buttons his shirt cuffs over metal bands and climbs to the road, showing perseverance but no interaction.
Peering out in hidden vantage as vehicle approaches, showing alertness and curiosity but no interpersonal warmth.
Offers to drive the car when the driver struggles, showing concern and willingness to help.
Does not respond with anger or retaliation after being shoved out of the car harshly by Burt.
Scrambles to thumb a ride aggressively, attempts to take initiative by offering to drive when the driver loses nerve.
Fails to anticipate the driver's hostility; is physically shoved and ejected from the car after his offer to drive, indicating a misjudgment of the social situation.
Deftly avoids boardwalk cops while walking through a crowded place.
Looks up warily and carefully observes the helicopter and the biplane overhead.
Seems initially perplexed by the helicopter overhead but quickly orients himself to understand he is on a film set, restoring order to his perception.
Shouting for medics at the sight of the carnage, showing immediate concern for injured people.
Comforted a small child clutching his leg, responding supportively to a frightened child.
Stares tensely at the carnage, then by reflex shouts for medics to help the injured.
Quietly mutters '...asshole...' after a tourist's comment, then turns away and avoids confrontation.
Excitedly points out and shouts to get someone's attention, showing engagement and social interaction.
Quietly mutters '...asshole...' when confronted with a frustrating or unsettling situation, showing emotional reaction but no clear skill or control.
Notices the helicopter landing and moves cautiously away from it, showing wariness and situational awareness.
Spots an actor on the beach who looks similar to Burt and excitedly points and calls out, but is mistaken about the actor's identity.
Drops off the edge of the pier into the water to try to save the Old Lady struggling in the sea.
Calmly reassures the Old Lady to not be afraid, showing presence of mind during a crisis.
Successfully handles the physical challenge of holding the Old Lady above water despite difficulty.
Chokes on water and reacts with surprise when the Old Lady reveals herself as a known actress, momentarily losing composure.
Carries Nina out of the water after she asks for rescue, grinning.
Waves to Nina to acknowledge her thanks before wandering off and not engaging further.
Tenses and faces Eli reluctantly when approached, indicating discomfort but does not run away.
Carries Nina safely through water toward shore despite her teasing request, showing physical capability and confidence.
Waves and wanders off after rescue without seeking recognition or engagement, suggesting possible social discomfort or low interpersonal assertiveness.
Tenses and faces Eli after being seen, indicating awareness and controlled response to confrontation.
Hesitates initially but follows Eli when compelled by his manner, showing some trust and willingness to engage.
Flustered and avoids explaining the reason behind the attack, indicating discomfort or evasiveness.
Uses derogatory wartime slang ('gooks') but justifies it as a known term to his group, showing insensitivity and a lack of tolerance.
Smiles up at Cameron while squatting, uses humor, puts hand on Cameron's shoulder showing reassurance.
Studied by Cameron but does not reveal personal information despite probing, shows guardedness.
Half laughs despite himself when Eli jokes, showing some openness and tolerance.
Suddenly grim reaction to Eli's questions about trouble with the law, indicating emotional reservation.
Responds to Eli's questioning carefully, does not reveal incriminating information, remains guarded.
Appears unsure and confused about Eli's intentions and the situation regarding the cops.
Half laughs at Eli's suggestion about stunt work, showing some adaptability and openness.
Displays vulnerability and confusion when confronted and taken into custody; allows Eli to put his arm around his shoulder and lead him away.
Does not argue or resist, showing passivity and possibly trust in Eli’s guidance after the chaotic situation.
Acknowledges he did not have a chance to speak, showing humility and openness.
Appears confused and wide-eyed, not defending himself clearly when confronted by Eli.
Passively goes along with the confused situation, allowing himself to be mistaken for someone else but is actually rescued by divers and brought safely back.
Looks the part of someone who survived an accident, with realistic bruises and wet clothes, showing an ability to fit into the role effectively.
Admits he didn't get to say anything and just listened during the confrontation, showing restraint and patience.
Is praised by Eli for having performed well in a tense situation despite limited input, suggesting underlying skill and potential.
Expresses concern about being recognized by the crew and local cops, showing vulnerability and self-awareness.
Does not openly dismiss Eli's encouragement, listens and follows along with the plan, suggesting trust and openness.
Shows mild humor and self-acceptance about his new hair color, smiling and complimenting the hairdresser's work.
Remains wary and cautious around Denise despite friendly interaction.
Accepts the hair transformation and expresses mild satisfaction, indicating adaptability and some confidence in his changed appearance.
Nods wearily in resignation and closes his eyes, showing exhaustion and lack of resistance rather than active problem-solving.
Shows mild embarrassment and plays along with Denise's teasing involving Nina's lingerie, sharing a close, playful moment with her.
Moves toward Denise's hand and face in a non-threatening, gentle way after she pulls him, showing relaxed and good-natured behavior.
Watches from the sidelines attentively, wearing a uniform similar to Raymond's, indicating he is ready and engaged.
Responds good-naturedly with self-deprecating humor about Vietnam experience.
Shows glibness and avoids directly answering stunt experience question.
Eagerly participates in stunt practice, responds positively to instruction, tries to improve after feedback.
Uses casual, friendly language ('Okie-dokie', 'Very fancy') showing openness and good-natured attitude.
Responds to Chuck's anger without retaliation or hostility, maintains a light, non-confrontational tone.
Pleads his case eloquently and genuinely, showing vulnerability and respect to Chuck.
Engages playfully with Chuck by running at him and flying over his shoulder.
Eloquently pleads his case by citing extensive relevant experience to gain trust and show competence.
Successfully executes a complex physical stunt (flying over Chuck’s shoulder, landing on a sharply slanted slate roof) without injury.
Is surprised by Chuck’s grin and genuinely questions if he is being teased, showing openness rather than insecurity.
Engages cooperatively with Chuck during the stunt preparations, shows a sense of humor about the danger.
Demonstrates skepticism and doubt about the safety equipment, showing honesty but potentially a critical attitude.
Scrambles to follow Chuck down the hazardous incline showing effort to keep up and learn.
Expresses concern about the danger realistically ('Or my brains are all over the pavement again, right?').
Questions the reliability of the awning catcher, showing skepticism and critical thinking.
Expresses excitement and joy about being paid well for a dangerous stunt.
Successfully completes a physically demanding stunt dangling from a gutter four stories high, showing alertness and endurance under strain.
Nearly falls during the stunt, displaying a momentary loss of control but recovers with help.
Calls out excitedly from the roof, acknowledging the payment with confidence and enthusiasm.
Is not mentioned or does not act in this excerpt.
Answers Eli's question about Vietnam with a sarcastic comparison to bubonic plague.
Bristles at Eli's needling comments, especially with Nina watching.
Responds to Eli's question about the nature of the film and war with a sharp, relevant metaphor: 'How'd you like bubonic plague?'
Engages confidently in a tense conversation about his Vietnam experience, showing composure despite Eli's needling and the presence of Nina.
Replies modestly about his wartime actions, diminishing his own violent acts ('...Hey, I didn't kill that many people...'), which may suggest some discomfort.
Eyes Eli with a wry smile after his deadly threat, showing a subtle acknowledgement but not escalating tension.
Starts to rise and excuse himself when Jake approaches, showing politeness and deference.
Eyes Eli with a wry smile at the tense moment and responds with dry humor, diffusing tension.
Notices Jake approaching and politely excuses himself to attend to the matter promptly.
Reacts with alarm when the film might reveal his presence, indicating concern for himself rather than openness.
Indicates Denise is helping with his appearance transformation, showing a degree of reliance on others.
Realizes the film might disclose his presence on the bridge and reacts with alarm, indicating awareness of potential consequences.
Does not see anyone at the scene and confidently answers Jake’s inquiry, maintaining his cover despite pressure.
Allows others to comment on his appearance and identity without challenging or clarifying, potentially missing an opportunity to assert control or clarify the situation.
Returns Denise's gaze calmly and silently watches Raymond wrapping his arm around Nina's shoulders without comment.
Yawns and announces going to bed, showing honest tiredness and readiness to rest.
Yawns and decides to go to bed despite ongoing discussions, showing awareness of own limits and confidence in managing energy.
Watches silently as Raymond interacts with Nina and the others, not intervening or contributing to the group dynamics.
Takes money from Sam's wallet, then leaves a small amount and returns the false teeth carelessly.
Avoids being seen by Nina and others when they arrive at the hotel.
Smiles warmly at Nina, answers sincerely about his feelings, shows boyish grin, playfully takes her hand and pulls her toward the tower, engaging in lighthearted interaction.
Responds sincerely and logically about the safety of the stunt, showing trust but also reasoned confidence in Eli's judgment.
Hesitates and wavers in his resolve to leave, showing uncertainty and internal conflict.
Takes initiative by laughing, pulling Nina's hand, and moving toward the tower despite earlier hesitation, demonstrating decisiveness.
Reassures Nina and offers support by saying 'I'll give you a push. Isn't that what a pal's for?'
Laughs and tries to lighten the mood despite Nina's fear, implying camaraderie.
Stops Nina when she tries to leave, taking her by the shoulders and engaging with her emotions seriously.
Admits to trembling quietly, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Encourages Nina to face her fear of heights and offers support by saying he'll give her a push.
Acknowledges Nina's fear but tries to downplay the danger by comparing the jump to robbing a candy store, showing confidence and some pragmatic optimism.
Physically restrains Nina when she tries to leave out of fear, showing assertiveness but potentially a lack of sensitivity to her feelings.
Denies being scared despite trembling, suggesting a confident attitude though potentially masking true feelings.
Receives affectionate squeeze from Nina, accepts it without discomfort.
Declines Eli's playful offer to ride the crane, opting to walk instead.
Expresses concern about Eli's promise to show the cop the film, indicating distrust.
Allows Eli to pull him unexpectedly into the basket despite prior distrust, showing some willingness to engage.
Politely refuses Eli's offer to ride in the crane basket and chooses to walk, showing self-control and caution.
Voices concern about Eli promising to show the film to the cop, indicating awareness of possible consequences and suspicion.
Is caught off guard when Eli unexpectedly pulls him into the basket causing him to drop a bag, showing a momentary lapse in control.
Receives a present but dismissively says 'Keep it' to Eli's advice.
Engages silently with Eli's probing, disarming, and quixotic conversation without reciprocating warmth.
Expresses gratitude and disbelief when offered help by Eli, showing vulnerability and openness.
Responds confidently and enthusiastically to Eli's offer, showing readiness to take on a challenge (swim like a fish).
Reacts with heart pounding and coiled tight physically, but continues to perform under gunfire and chaotic conditions.
Vaults over the railing of the bell tower under machine gun fire, twists and launches himself across the gap between buildings, scrambles for a handhold, and moves like an animal to safety.
Engages in physical combat with multiple enemies, wrestles down an opponent while maintaining awareness of a lethal environment, and manages to pull himself back onto the roof despite injuries.
Sweat pouring, bleeding, yet continuing to evade and push forward under extreme stress and danger.
Struggles helplessly and lashes out in confusion and fury when seized and stripped by others.
Accepts public acclaim and warmth after humiliation, quietly regains poise despite anger.
Does not retaliate aggressively and allows himself to be helped and attended to after the stunt.
Maintains physical struggle and resists the crowd despite confusion and helplessness.
Shows inability to control the situation as he is stripped and humiliated, indicating a lack of situational control.
Recovers poise quickly after public humiliation and embraces the warmth of public acclaim.
Quietly confronts Chuck about not warning him of danger, showing vulnerability and concern for his safety.
Acknowledges Eli's compliment and offers to do the stunt again if needed, showing friendliness and sincerity.
Expresses conflicted feelings about Eli's control, admitting he feels grateful despite frustration, showing tolerance and honesty.
Worries about not being informed of the awning hazard, indicating concern for safety and situational awareness.
Admits to being in pain and wincing, showing vulnerability but also seeking information and clarity.
Offers to do the stunt again if anything bothered Eli, showing confidence and willingness to confront challenges.
Observes Eli's influence over others and recognizes his own reaction, demonstrating insight into social dynamics.
Questions why Chuck did not inform him about potential danger, which could show a lack of situational control or preparation.
Responds to Eli's patronizing tone with sarcastic but playful comeback.
Makes a crude joke about wartime enemies, displaying insensitivity.
Responds to Eli's patronizing tone with sarcastic and biting remarks, showing wit and presence of mind.
Feels humiliated by Eli's tone but masks it through sarcasm rather than confrontation, indicating mixed confidence.
Views the Duesenberg with a strange sense of unease, allows Eli to lead him through a crowded, smoke-filled storage room without taking initiative or showing confidence.
Steps toward Nina without thinking to get her out of the crowded room.
Responds to Eli's joke with a quick, confident retort showing social awareness.
Surprisingly feels anger at Nina's presence and the group's familiarity with her, but doesn't act out aggressively or irrationally.
Responds to teasing with sarcasm and anger, then storms out in a rage.
Responds sharply and walks out in a rage after a tense exchange, unable to manage emotions constructively.
Uses sarcasm and pointed language to confront Eli, showing some verbal skill.
Walks over and sits beside Nina, whispering to her, showing interest and attempting connection.
Continues to sit beside Nina after she moves away, asks what's the matter, showing concern.
Is stunned, then angry, then resigned to the ways of women after Nina ignores him, indicating emotional vulnerability and some insecurity.
Engages in a tense exchange with Nina, appears somewhat sarcastic or resigned in responses ('Thanks', 'But he can say anything and that's okay...'), showing possible bitterness or defensiveness.
Sits numbly staring at the screen after Nina leaves upset, indicating emotional impact and possible sensitivity.
Is startled and embarrassed when overhearing a conversation; responds honestly and with a touch of humor about facing death by imagining dancing a jig.
Startled and embarrassed when unexpectedly acknowledged, momentarily off guard in the conversation.
Responds thoughtfully and imaginatively to Eli's challenge about what he would do on the wing of the plane, showing creative thinking.
Executes a complex stunt involving jumping from a burning parachute and climbing onto a plane wing under gunfire, showing physical skill and presence of mind.
Quickly takes off dead German pilot’s boots and helmet to blend in and prepare for escape.
Shares laughter and champagne with the pilot in a playful, friendly manner during the stunt flight.
Dances the Charleston on the wing and engages in lighthearted antics with the pilot, joining in the pilot's song.
Appears drunk and loses balance, but keeps interacting positively without causing distress.
Balances and stands on the wing of a flying vintage plane while drinking champagne and interacting confidently with the pilot.
Appears drunk and loses balance, grabbing the strut for support.
Despite apparent intoxication, moves skillfully along the guywires and dances the Charleston on the wing, effectively maintaining control.
Nina caresses his bruises and kisses them gently; Cameron reciprocates physical affection openly.
Stops to touch Nina's wig after waking, indicating subtle attentiveness or tenderness toward her interests.
Ignores the still-ringing alarm clock despite Nina asking him to turn it off, suggesting distraction or inattentiveness.
Regains his footing on a crashing plane wing and looks forward with growing horror.
Is hurled off the wing during the crash, indicating possible failure to maintain safety or control.
His reaction to the accident is shock and a sharp cry, but the scene shifts to sexual content rather than crisis management.
Lies quietly in bed bruised but serene, allowing Nina to notice and care, showing some resilience but no proactive behavior.

Ignores ringing alarm clock that others want turned off; sets off alarm repeatedly despite it disturbing others.
Playfully suggests doubling for both roles to earn money and appears confident in his appearance.

Expresses awareness of potential consequences if the scene is not studied but enjoys provoking a reaction and embraces the chaotic situation.
Engages playfully and affectionately with Nina, giggling and making light of the ringing alarm during intimate moment.
Demonstrates a jokingly supportive attitude toward Eli by sarcastically addressing the ringing clock as if it were Eli.
Leans in to observe Chuck's distress and the film of Burt's death, showing interest and presence, but no direct comforting or reassurance shown.
Leans into a playful, intimate moment confidently despite distractions (alarm ringing), showing ease and composure.
Observes the film carefully with Chuck, pointing out details about Burt’s struggle, demonstrating attentiveness and understanding of the scene.
Notices the crack in the windshield and interprets its significance correctly, feeling relief that it is not causing water leakage or the accident.
Questions the ending of the story (the flyer dying in the water), demonstrating critical thinking about the narrative rather than accepting it passively.
Appeases Denise by admitting fear of rushing into a relationship, showing consideration for her feelings.
Describes his dangerous stunt work casually and expresses a need for a rest, indicating self-awareness and realistic assessment of his workload.
Admits to being scared and hesitant about calling Denise, showing social insecurity and lack of confidence in interpersonal communication.
Shows vulnerability and emotional sensitivity when Denise teases him about Nina and Eli, reacting visibly with hurt and sinking back slowly.
Shows emotional vulnerability and retreats when confronted with unsettling personal revelations, sinking back in the chair slowly dying.

Refuses to participate in the stunt, expressing frustration and resentment about being 'somebody's clown'.
Dismisses Eli's offer to join in brotherly love with a sarcastic, bitter remark.

Maintains presence of mind and physical agility under extreme, chaotic danger during a battle scene.
Frantically beats out an ember burning through his asbestos protector, prioritizing safety despite being distracted.
Lies coldly on bed glaring with mounting rage at Nina’s campy sarcastic performance and withdrawal of invitation.

Responds coldly and with mounting rage to Nina’s sarcastic performance, maintaining control rather than reacting impulsively.
Responds coldly and angrily to Nina's sarcastic comment about her relationship with the director, showing hostility.

Coldly confronts Nina with a sharp, pointed question revealing awareness and confidence in addressing uncomfortable truths.
Reacts with mounting rage, pacing between bathroom and bed, seemingly unable to calm down or compose himself.

Interrupts Sam angrily during an explanation, suggesting impatience and possible inability to process or calmly engage with information.

Casually rummages through Sam’s clothes despite Sam’s concern, showing disregard for Sam's feelings.

Feels dumb and full of regrets after conversation but quickly recovers and changes focus.
Searches a crowded restaurant attentively, noticing subtle details like the half-eaten birthday cake and familiar features, indicating observational skill.
Approaches a family at what appears to be their birthday party with hesitation and humor, engaging kindly with them.
Refers to Nina with affection and sincerity, calling her 'a very rare mineral' and showing concern for her emotions.
Responds warmly to Nina's vulnerable, emotional state and kisses her tenderly at her hotel room door.

Demonstrates social perceptiveness by recognizing humor and establishing rapport with the family, adapting quickly to an awkward situation.
Does not appear to hesitate or fumble when noticing Nina and responding emotionally (kisses her at the hotel door).
Kisses Nina warmly and responds to her raincheck request with a playful, sincere 'season pass' comment.
Notices Henry sitting alone at the bar and goes over to him, showing friendliness and solidarity.

Prevents Henry from involving the police impulsively by taking the dime and diverting the situation; tries to calmly remove Henry from danger by getting him a cab to the airport.
Dismisses Henry's account of being assaulted by the 'crazy man,' expressing confusion and disbelief about Henry's claims.
Grabs the dime from Henry's fingers and drops it into a peanut vending machine to prevent Henry from blowing the whistle.
Stuffs peanuts in Henry's pocket, grabs his suitcase, and hustles him out of the bar toward the front door, seemingly taking control of the situation.
Declares confidently that the dangerous man cannot hurt him and that he will go to the cops.
Shows confusion and disbelief at Henry's bruises and claims to have watched the entire incident and seen nothing happen.
Stands pale and shaken after hearing Henry's account of the director's callousness.

In shock and anger, leaning forward on the edge of his chair, looking from Eli to the parents, not knowing what to do to stop this.

Expresses feelings of helplessness and being trapped by the script, indicating a lack of control or agency.
Appraises the Duesenberg and grins as a plan starts to form, suggesting quick thinking and confidence in problem-solving.
Firmly and sternly tells Nina to get out of the trunk, rejecting her alternate ending and showing impatience and anger.
Formulates a strategic plan to get a fifteen-minute jump on the crew by using a rewrite.
Evaluates Nina's proposed alternate ending carefully and voices concerns, showing critical thinking.
Firmly and sternly insists Nina get out of the trunk, attempting to maintain control over the situation.
Displays anger and frustration, telling Nina to stay out and expressing that this isn't the time for her neurotic problems.
Urgently warns Nina about approaching workmen, helping her avoid being caught.
Urgently warns Nina of approaching workmen and instructs her to hide in the trunk, effectively preventing their discovery.
Steps out through the doorway buttoning his costume, moving uncertainly toward the Duesenberg.
Approaches the Duesenberg uncertainly but remains focused on checking it carefully.
Responds flatly and with a bit of dry humor to Chuck's teasing about his physique.
Tenses at the mention of an upcoming stunt indicating concern or apprehension.
Walks around the Duesenberg, testing and checking it while moving relentlessly toward the humpback trunk.
Responds flatly and confidently to Chuck's teasing about 'loose change' growing.
Tenses at the information about the truck coming down the road and soldiers shooting, showing some visible nervousness.
Expresses concern that the guns might not be blanks.
Attempts to open the trunk to get Nina out of danger.
Responds numbly and passively when stopped by Raymond and a technician's call.
Casually leans against the trunk and attempts to open it to get Nina out, showing determination.
Is unnerved by the sight of cops with guns and seems dazed when called for a stunt, moving numbly to the car door.
Looks straight ahead without responding when asked if the camera is on, barely hearing the question.
Panics internally fearing exposure of his identity, then abruptly speeds off the car causing chaos.
Automatically responds to the word 'CAMERA ON' as if his own name is called, showing a reflexive but confused reaction.
Panics and accidentally starts the car prematurely, causing chaos on set.
Calls out to Nina in a caring way during the dangerous car stunt, asking if she's okay.
Expresses triumphant joy and exuberance during the stunt, showing friendly enthusiasm.
Screams Nina's name in anguish after the crash, showing deep concern and emotional connection.
Grips the wheel tightly, confidently accelerates the car at high speed while communicating with Nina, showing excitement and control.
Extends middle finger for the camera at a risky moment, realizing a perfect close-up shot, showing awareness and presence of mind.
Screams in anguish when the car is sabotaged and out of control, reflecting emotional vulnerability but no failure in skill.
Screams in anguish and desperation calling out for Nina.
Desperately tries to save Nina by tearing off seatbelt and clawing toward back seat.
Feels total betrayal that even Nina has conspired against him.
Remembers Chuck’s advice and acts to lower window despite worsening situation.
Struggles underwater to find and use the oxygen mask despite failing due to the broken tube; moves with motor reflex and survival instinct to reach the surface and shore.
Is exhausted and barely able to move by the time he reaches the shore; surrenders passively when captured by armed men.
Laughs and giggles after a harrowing experience, showing relief and a light-hearted reaction.
Receives care and attention from Chuck and acknowledges others’ efforts, indicating some level of trust and tolerance.
Remains calm and recognizes the scene as a staged movie event despite the aggression, showing situational awareness and mental composure.
Laughs and accepts assistance from Chuck, allowing himself to be cared for after a stunt, demonstrating trust and practical self-preservation.
Does not try to control the chaotic environment or intervene, merely reacts passively to the confusion and unfolding events.
Grins with good nature and waves back encouragingly to Nina despite her difficulties crossing the swamp.
Responds to Nina's concerns with good-natured humor and calmness, indicating confidence and ease.
Waves back casually after Nina reports being found, demonstrating composed and steady demeanor in a potentially stressful situation.
Receives Nina's muddy, affectionate hug warmly and shows pleasure.
Questions Eli about risking his safety but does so without hostility, showing concern.
Does not react negatively or harshly to Eli's decision to keep him alive for filming despite danger, indicating trust and tolerance.
Thanks Eli and politely declines the dangerous helicopter ride to take a safer one with Jake, wishing Eli good luck.
Argues aggressively and accuses Eli of trying to cheat him out of money with a harsh tone.
Screams and demands payment from Eli, accuses him of using people.
Shouts demanding a thousand bucks and complains about being used, but fails to negotiate effectively when offered less.
Persistently confronts Eli despite Eli being in control and leaving the scene, showing assertiveness.
